item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Now that would be superb! In fact there's probably a market for a server that is available over a "safe" port (80 or 443) for independent consultants.<br /><br />Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Now that would be superb! In fact there’s probably a market for a server that is available over a “safe” port (80 or 443) for independent consultants.

Matt

item.description: <p>So we just need to find you a publicly available Activities server to use.</p>
item.content:encoded: So we just need to find you a publicly available Activities server to use.

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>I'd love to Mac but being an independent consultant I have multiple clients, many of whom don't allow me to access my own server while on their site. I do agree it would be a good solution if I were based in one place all the time.<br /><br />Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
I’d love to Mac but being an independent consultant I have multiple clients, many of whom don’t allow me to access my own server while on their site. I do agree it would be a good solution if I were based in one place all the time.

Matt

item.title: By: mac guidera
item.dc:creator: mac guidera
item.description: <p>Without trying to sound like I am pulling company line too hard, I would suggest you have a look at Activities. It has allowed me to be more on top of my todos and given me and team members focus when working on shared objectives. I really like it.</p>
item.content:encoded: Without trying to sound like I am pulling company line too hard, I would suggest you have a look at Activities. It has allowed me to be more on top of my todos and given me and team members focus when working on shared objectives. I really like it.

item.title: By: Philip Storry
item.dc:creator: Philip Storry
item.description: <p>I don't use a task manager anymore.<br/><br /><br/><br />I should, but I don't. It's on my to-do list of things to investigate.<br/><br />Well, it would be, if I had a to-do list.<br/><br /><br/><br />I used to use - and still could, but want to wean myself off it - Agendus for Palm and Windows.<br/><br />{ <a href="<a rel="nofollow" href="http://www.iambic.com/agenduspro/palmos/details.asp"" rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.iambic.com/agenduspro/palmos/details.asp"</a> rel="nofollow" target ="blank">Link</a> }<br/><br /><br/><br />It's fantastic, but I'm on the previous version (11) and won't move up because I'm not going to be using either the Palm or Windows anymore.<br/><br /><br/><br />The main features I love are:<br/><br />* Decent categorisation & filtering<br/><br />* Repeat & Redo your to-dos<br/><br />* Franklin-Covey Matrix assignment for additional priority sorting<br/><br />* Simple but stupid - I can assign icons of my choosing to tasks, so that I can see at a glance what they are for<br/><br />* Being able to assign a contact to a task<br/><br /><br/><br />I know I should use a task list manager, but seem to struggle along without one well enough at the moment, so replacing Agendus is a low priority - especially as it'd be a tough call!<br/><br /><br/><br />If there was an Agendus-like web application that also synced with other systems via iCalendar or SyncML, I'd be very happy.<br/><br /><br/><br />As it stands, I may have to put that at the bottom of the list of things I need to write for myself...<br/><br /><img alt="Emoticon" src="<a rel="nofollow ugc">http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GL7/$File/undecided.gif"</a> /><br/><br /></p>
item.content:encoded:
I don’t use a task manager anymore.

I should, but I don’t. It’s on my to-do list of things to investigate.

Well, it would be, if I had a to-do list.

I used to use – and still could, but want to wean myself off it – Agendus for Palm and Windows.

{ http://www.iambic.com/agenduspro/palmos/details.asp“ rel=”nofollow” target =”blank”>Link }

It’s fantastic, but I’m on the previous version (11) and won’t move up because I’m not going to be using either the Palm or Windows anymore.

The main features I love are:

* Decent categorisation & filtering

* Repeat & Redo your to-dos

* Franklin-Covey Matrix assignment for additional priority sorting

* Simple but stupid – I can assign icons of my choosing to tasks, so that I can see at a glance what they are for

* Being able to assign a contact to a task

I know I should use a task list manager, but seem to struggle along without one well enough at the moment, so replacing Agendus is a low priority – especially as it’d be a tough call!

If there was an Agendus-like web application that also synced with other systems via iCalendar or SyncML, I’d be very happy.

As it stands, I may have to put that at the bottom of the list of things I need to write for myself…

http://www.11tmr.com/11tmr.nsf/emoticons/DLYH-5N3GL7/$File/undecided.gif“ />
